topics.title: public proxies
topics.body: If anyone has the resources , publicly available proxies would be great . If you have one up and running , please post the address .

1@13.body: i think zerotalk could become a stable social networking and messaging platform , if nofish will continue developing it . adding messaging and some kind of profile for users to be able to establish will be quite sufficient .
I do not get how U quote me nofish :( I'm too lazy to go checking trough the code :D
anyways , I think some kind of social networking platform would be a great win . It would certainly help popularise zeronet .

2@20.body: nofish dont go the tor way please . tor is backdoored .
well if you do implement them , make it optional . tor is nothing but a big honeypot made by amerikans .

3@2.body:
nofish , have you considered making a web-frontend for configuring the proxy ? at the moment all the folk who use ZN are enthusiasts willing to mess arround with a bunch of json files . but in the future , if you plan to give zeronet to the masses (a thing you must do!! :P ) , there should be an interface to control features of one's zeronet installation . for instance , if a user has more than one zero-talk servers he registers on , it would be nice to have an UI to manipulate those identities .
or if a new user wants to create a new site , he could create it with a couple clicks . 
I know you work hard on ZN , and this would be extra effort , but from what I've seen from you , it's a piece of cake for U ...

1@125.body: wouldn't it be better to have public-facing proxies where we can browse zeronet when we don't have possibility to run it ? there were a couple of them , but all died recently :(

I ment for browsing purposes only . Running zeronet on android is even less private than in the public proxy scenario . I might or might not manipulate your data , you can't be certain . But google will most certainly log everything you do on your android .

1@134.body:
there is a site with a public key that anyone can sedit , and add their site to the list ;
http://127.0.0.1:43110/18qigy8XcrxLpK7QaS52FfjwN2gjqHE231

1@148.body: and here comes a guy who will utilise 0net's true potential . great work twolostnames !!
